ThingDef.label: Shipflesh
ThingDef.description: The flesh of a a bioship. Grown from the Shipheart, guided by protein scaffolds.

ThingDef.label: shipflesh
ThingDef.description: The flesh of a a bioship. Grown from the Shipheart, guided by protein scaffolds.

ThingDef.Name: BioShipCorner
ThingDef.description: Angled armor for a ship's outer hull.

ThingDef.label: shipflesh floor
ThingDef.description: Fleshy floors

ThingDef.label: bioship sphintcer
ThingDef.description: Allows access to a ship or divides rooms inside it. A permiable mucus layer prevents the loss of gasses.

ThingDef.label: small biorocket engine
ThingDef.description: A psi-engine capable of launching a ship into orbit. Utilizes shaped solar-pinholes to generate thrust. Not suitable for interplanetary travel.

ThingDef.label: Organic RCS thruster
ThingDef.description: A small thruster that is required to reposition ships. One is required for every 2000 weight.

ThingDef.label: biorocket engine
ThingDef.description: A psiengine capable of launching a ship into orbit. Not suitable for interplanetary travel.\n\nIn combat, provides double the speed of smaller engines at the cost of double fuel consumption.

ThingDef.label: nuclear bioengine
ThingDef.description: A nuclear-powered engine capable of launching a ship into orbit, at the cost of irradiating the surrounding area. Not suitable for interplanetary travel.\n\nProvides six times the speed of small engines.

ThingDef.label: bioship sensors
ThingDef.description: Basic ship sensors. Capable of detecting nearby craft and observing sites from orbit.

ThingDef.label: small ship maw
ThingDef.description: Small shipmaw.

ThingDef.label: corpse maw
ThingDef.description: Corpse maw.

ThingDef.label: fat store
ThingDef.description: Stores 25 nutrition units worth of fat.

ThingDef.label: fat store
ThingDef.description: Stores 250 nutrition units worth of fat.

ThingDef.label: psi shield ganglia
ThingDef.description:
A cluster of specialized neurons specialized for projecting a skip shield. Shots can go out, but not in.

Generates heat when it blocks attacks. If no heatsink capacity is available, the shield will be damaged and require repairs.

Ship radiators cannot disperse heat while shields are up. Captains are advised to drop shields once heatsinks are close to capacity, or risk their ships turning into ovens.

ThingDef.label: organic heatsink
ThingDef.description:
A liquid-cooled heatsink for storing excess heat. Slowly bleeds heat into the surrounding room; will not function in vacuum.

Heat capacity: 115
Heat released: 0.5/s

ThingDef.label: organic heatsink
ThingDef.description:
A liquid-cooled heatsink for storing excess heat. Slowly bleeds heat into the surrounding room; will not function in vacuum.

Heat capacity: 115
Heat released: 0.5/s

ThingDef.label: coolant cyst
ThingDef.description:
A cyst containing a reserve of coolant.

Heat capacity: 800Hu
Heat loss: 6Hu/s

ThingDef.label: large coolant cyst
ThingDef.description:
A large cyst containg coolant. Slowly bleeds heat into the surrounding room if not in vacuum.

Heat capacity: 4000Hu
Heat loss: 18Hu/s

ThingDef.label: thermal bile purge duct
ThingDef.description: Superheated bile is expelled through this duct, allowing the ship to rapidly cool itself. Shields will be dropped during a purge.

ThingDef.label: large thermal bile purge duct
ThingDef.description: Superheated bile is expelled through this duct, allowing the ship to rapidly cool itself. Ejecting molten silver into space is a costly way to quickly purge stored heat. Shields will be dropped during a purge.

ThingDef.label: giant mitochondria
ThingDef.description: A giant mitochondira, the powerhouse of the beast.

ThingDef.label: colossal mitochondria
ThingDef.description: A colossal mitochondira, the powerhouse of the beast.

ThingDef.label: organic vent
ThingDef.description: Exchanges heat with the coolant network, cooling or heating a ship's interior to the desired temperature.\n\nCan also heat rooms with electricity.

ThingDef.label: bio capacitor
ThingDef.description: Efficiently stores up to 1,000Wd of energy.

ThingDef.label: salvage maw
ThingDef.description: Harvests the remains of enemy ships after a battle. Each salvage bay can retrieve up to 1,000kg of material from a ship.

ThingDef.label: haul beast eggsac cluster
ThingDef.description: An eggsac in which a haulbeast will gestate.

ThingDef.label: haul beast eggsac cluster
ThingDef.description: A cluster of eggsacs in which a three haulbeasts will gestate.

ThingDef.label: warbeast eggsac
ThingDef.description: A eggsac capable of spawning a warbeast.
